channel.title: Ipod touch restore purchases
channel.description: So my ipod was jailbroken and i had a bunch of songs on it (purchased from itunes, not dtunes) and i switched computers. My ipod just crashed and it displayed the usb > itunes thing on the screen so im guessing i had to plug it into itunes. I plugged it in and it told me to enter my passcode on my ipod, which wouldn't get off the same screen so i just did a force restore. I am logged onto the same account that i bought all of the songs on, how can i re-download all of my purchases onto my ipod?

item.title: Ipod touch restore purchases
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:19, topic:339360”][quote author=Tico link=topic=435743.msg3200638#msg3200638 date=1273292299]
You can’t get your songs back. Apple is very strict about that, the only way would be to use the original computer (if you transferred purchased items to iTunes during a sync) and then re-sync those items from there. Other than that, there is no way to redownload content that has already been purchased on your account, like microsoft does with xbox live content.
[/quote]seems like downloading songs the legit way fucks you over compared to illegally downloading[/quote]

Exactly, and still record companies wonder why people pirate music. It’s because you can pay good money and have restrictions put on you, or pirate it and have no restrictions put on you.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod touch restore purchases
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:10, topic:339360”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=435743.msg3200779#msg3200779 date=1273320249]
http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1469

When you buy a song, video, iPod Game, or album from the iTunes Store, you are entitled to download it only once.

[/quote]
This is false, just go re-buy everything then claim the money back saying you mis-understood their terms. I did it and claimed back £10.99 on a film i wanted.[/quote]

Nice lie.

Read full topic

like microsoft does with xbox live content.

You misunderstood. I stated that with Apple you may only download purchased content once, and with xbox livve, you may download purchased content as many times as needed.[/quote]Ic. My bad

item.title: Ipod touch restore purchases
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Baros Rocks:

Pretty sure you can redownload the applications you’ve bought from itunes, when you go on the appstore in your ipod and try to download one you’ve bought it says you’ve already purchased it and will be free.

“You have already purchased this song. To purchase again press buy”

Read full topic

item.description:

hmm that sucks… my mates wanting me to sync my itunes onto his phone so he has all my music… but he bought and downloaded some albums (he doesnt have the internet at his house) without being connected to the net… does this mean he will have to pay for em again if i sync em over?

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod touch restore purchases
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Did you jailbreak with blackra1n? Also, if you haven’t re-jailbroken yet, use spirit next time, it gives an untethered jailbreak (which blackra1n doesn’t) and is more efficient.

ontopic: store > check for available downloads
